prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: SB1 (4 sources)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
We will study dust continuum and CO line emission, using Single continuum tunned at 221 GHz in order to observe CO emission from the four mergers of this Science Goal. Four merging systems located whithin 10 degrees in the sky. They are at early and intermediate stages (first contact and pre-merger), more detailes in Section Science Justification.
(Stages: first contact, pre-merger, pre-merger, first contact)

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: These objects are distributed whithin 10 degrees, optimizing calibration time. We group these four galaxies in order to detect CO emission from the four systems. Continuum fluxes for the targets have been calculated according to Scoville (2012) flux relation (see Section Science Justification). The minimum estimated flux density at 243 GHz (Band 6) is 9 mJy. In order to obtain a S/N of 5 on the 22 beams needed for this source, a sensitivity of 0.08 mJy is required. The largest object has an angular size of 60'', we consider an angular resolution of 1.5'' in order to study the morphology of the dust in each object. Thus, we need ACA observations in order to obtain the large scales of the system. Sky frequency is tuned at 221 GHz in order to obtain CO emission for the four merging systems. Baseband 4 is used as the representative frequency for this science goal. For Band 6 with 34 antennas in Dual polarizarion, the estimated time is 2.77 hours to achieve a sensitivity of 0.08 mJy. The time on source is 28.78min, plus 26.56min for calibrators and overheads, plus 1.84 h for ACA.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: SB1 (2 sources)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
We will study dust continuum and CO line emission, using Single continuum tunned at 226.9 GHz in order to observe CO emission from the two mergers of this Science Goal. Two merging systems located whithin 10 degrees in the sky. They are at early and intermediate stages (first contact and pre-merger), more detailes in Section Science Justification.
(Stages: pre-merger, pre-merger)

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: These objects are distributed whithin 10 degrees, grouped to detect CO emission for the two objects. Continuum fluxes for the targets have been calculated according to Scoville (2012) flux relation (see Section Science Justification). The minimum estimated flux density per beam at 243 GHz is 9 mJy. In order to obtain a S/N of 5 on the 23 beams needed for this source, a sensitivity of 0.08 mJy is required. The largest object has an angular size of 40'', we consider an angular resolution of 1.5'' in order to study the morphology of the dust in each object. Sky frequency is tuned at 226.9 GHz in order to obtain CO emission for the two merging systems. Baseband 4 is used as the representative frequency for this science goal. For Band 6 with 34 antennas in Dual polarizarion, the estimated time is XX to achieve a sensitivity of For Band 6 with 34 antennas in Dual polarizarion, the estimated time is 2.32 hours to achieve a sensitivity of 0.08 mJy. The time on source is 17.74min, plus 28.58min for calibrators and overheads, plus 1.54 h for ACA.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: SB3 (3 sources)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
We will study dust continuum and CO line emission, using Single continuum tunned at 221.92 GHz in order to observe CO emission from the three mergers of this Science Goal. Three merging systems located whithin 10 degrees in the sky. They are at early and intermediate stages (first contact and pre-merger), more detailes in Section Science Justification.
(Stages: pre-merger, first contact, first contact)

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: These objects are distributed whithin 10 degrees, grouped to detect CO emission for the three objects. Continuum fluxes for the targets have been calculated according to Scoville (2012) flux relation (see Section Science Justification). The minimum estimated flux density at 243 GHz is 9 mJy. In order to obtain a S/N of 5 on the 23 beams needed for this source, a sensitivity of 0.08 mJy is required. The largest object has an angular size of 20'', we consider an angular resolution of 1.5'' in order to study the morphology of the dust in each object. Sky frequency is tuned at 221.92 GHz in order to obtain CO emission for the three merging systems. Baseband 4 is used as the representative frequency for this science goal. For Band 6 with 34 antennas in Dual polarizarion, the estimated time is 2.24 h to achieve a sensitivity of 0.08mJy. For Band 6 with 34 antennas in Dual polarizarion, the estimated time is 2.24 hours to achieve a sensitivity of 0.08 mJy. The time on source is 16.33min, plus 28.53min for calibrators and overheads, plus 1.5 h for ACA.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: SB4 (2 sources)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
We will study dust continuum and CO line emission, using Single continuum tunned at 228.3 GHz in order to observe CO emission from the two mergers of this Science Goal. Two merging systems located whithin 10 degrees in the sky. They are at early and intermediate stages (first contact and pre-merger), more detailes in Section Science Justification.
(Stages: pre-merger, first approach)

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: These objects are distributed whithin 10 degrees, grouped to detect CO emission for the two objects. Continuum fluxes for the targets have been calculated according to Scoville (2012) flux relation (see Section Science Justification). The minimum estimated flux density per beam at 243 GHz is 13 mJy. In order to obtain a S/N of 6 on the 23 beams needed for this source, a sensitivity of 0.1 mJy is required. A sensitivity of 0.1 mJy is needed to obtain a S/N of 6. The largest object has an angular size of 20'', we consider an angular resolution of 1.5'' in order to study the morphology of the dust in each object. Sky frequency is tuned at 228.3 GHz in order to obtain CO emission for the two merging systems. Baseband 4 is used as the representative frequency for this science goal. For Band 6 with 34 antennas in Dual polarizarion, the estimated time is XX to achieve a sensitivity ofFor Band 6 with 34 antennas in Dual polarizarion, the estimated time is 2.11 hours to achieve a sensitivity of 0.1 mJy. The time on source is 13.76min, plus 28.38min for calibrators and overheads, plus 1.40 h for ACA.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose a modest 3.1 hours pilot study of the molecular gas and continuum emission in 11 Galaxy merger systems from SDSS Stripe 82. This well-defined sample consists of the brightest H_alpha emitters from the complete sample of Galaxy Zoo mergers in Stripe 82, and primarily consist of early and intermediate stage mergers. Our immediate goal is to constrain the kinematics (CO J:2-1), and morphology (CO J:2-1 and dust continuum) in Band 6. The extensive multi-wavelength coverage of Stripe 82, the completeness of the sample (Galaxy Zoo) and the match between galaxy size and the ALMA FOV, in addition to the high resolution and sensitivity, all make this an ideal pilot sample to study the evolution of gas and dust along the merger sequence.
